element.name: TDoublePoint
element.short: Data type for a point with floating point coordinates X and Y

element.name: TDoubleRect
element.short: Data structure for a rectangle with floating point coordinates defined by opposite corner points a and b or by a 4-element array

element.name: TOverrideColor
element.short: Enumeration of elements deciding whether a color will override a brush or pen color.

element.name: TOverrideColors
element.short: Set of elements deciding whether a color will override a brush or pen color.

element.name: TPointArray
element.short: Dynamic array of records (having integer coordinates)

element.name: TDoublePointArray
element.short: Dynamic array of records (having floating point coordinates)

element.name: TPointBoolArr
element.short: Helper type which allows to interpret a TPoint record as an integer array.
element.descr: For a TPoint variable P, the type-cast TPointBoolArr(P)[b] returns P.X when the boolean variable b is false, and P.Y when it is true.

element.name: TDoublePointBoolArr
element.short: Helper type which allows to interpret a TDoublePoint record as a floating point array.
element.descr:
For a
variable P, the type-cast TDoublePointBoolArr(P)[b] returns P.X when the boolean variable b is false, and P.Y when it is true.

element.name: TDoubleInterval
element.short: Data type for an interval of floating point numbers.

element.name: TSeriesMarksStyle
element.short: Defines which information is displayed in the text of a series label

ul.li: smsValue: y value of the series, e.g. '1234'
smsPercent: percentage of the y value, e.g. '12 %'
smsLabel: text assigned to the data point, e.g. 'Cars'
smsLabelPercent: text assigned to the data point, and percentage of the y value, e.g. 'Cars 12 %'
smsLabelValue: text assigned to the data point, and y value, e.g. 'Cars 1234'
smsPercentTotal: percentage and the total of the y values, e.g. '12 % of 1234'
smsLabelPercentTotal: text assigned to the data point, percentage and total of all y values, e.g. 'Cars 12 % of 1234'
smsXValue: x value of the data point

element.name: TChartTextFormat
element.short: Enumeration of two ways how text can be interpreted by TAChart: either directly or as being encoded in HTML.

ul.li: tfHTML: Text is assumed to contain simple HTML markup which is respected by the drawing routines.
